Company Short Description: Medical Connections Ltd is a small, innovative medical imaging software and consultancy business, created with the aim of making medical image integration simpler, reliable and cheaper. Medical Connections was founded by the late Dr David Harvey and now jointly owned and run by Rapten Bhutia, Qian Wang and Philippa Webb.Our toolkit assists development of DICOM conformant applications for medical imaging. They are available for COM/ActiveX environment and .NET framework. Medical Connections also provides consultancy services in the field of medical image integration, and has advised suppliers, integrators, purchasers and government agencies on how best to achieve their goals in this area. This can include advice on choice of communication methods, conformance testing and even dispute resolution. In addition, we can provide customised software solutions for specific DICOM needs, such as routing, tag morphing, etc.
personalized_line: I imagine that with a medical business, you're constantly balancing patient care with financial management, including tax considerations that affect profitability.

Company Short Description: Aerospace Xelerated is a startup accelerator program launched by The Boeing Company in 2019. It focuses on supporting early-stage software startups that aim to innovate within the aerospace industry and beyond. The program collaborates with various industry, corporate, and government partners to provide investment, mentorship, and networking opportunities for startups and small to medium-sized enterprises (SMEs).Participants in Aerospace Xelerated receive an initial equity investment of Â£100,000, with the possibility of additional funding from partners. The program offers expert mentorship to help startups navigate the aerospace sector and connects them with a network of angel investors and venture capitalists. Startups also benefit from over Â£100,000 in program perks from partners like Oracle and Amazon. To date, Aerospace Xelerated has supported over 40 companies across multiple verticals and countries, helping them raise an additional Â£250 million in funding and create over 750 high-skilled jobs.
